questions.question: What is the full form of CRO?

explanations.b: Correct. CRO stands for Cathode Ray Oscilloscope.

questions.question: Which device is used to measure voltage, current, and resistance?

explanations.a: CRO is mainly used to visualize signals.
explanations.c: Correct. A multimeter measures voltage, current, and resistance.

questions.question: Which component of a CRO deflects the electron beam vertically?

explanations.b: Correct. Vertical plates control vertical motion.

questions.question: In a CRO, what is displayed on the X-axis?

explanations.a: Voltage is typically on the Y-axis.
explanations.c: Correct. Time is on the horizontal axis.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of a multimeter?

explanations.b: Correct. Waveforms are generated by function generators or CROs.
explanations.d: Many digital multimeters measure AC current.

questions.question: What is the typical input resistance of a CRO?

explanations.b: Correct. CRO input impedance is usually about 1 megaohm.
explanations.c: Too low for accurate signal capture.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'time/div' knob on a CRO?

explanations.b: Frequency is not set by CRO.
explanations.c: Correct. It sets the time scale for waveform display.

questions.question: Which mode in a multimeter is used to test continuity?

explanations.a: Used to measure voltage, not continuity.
explanations.b: Measures resistance, but continuity is different.
explanations.c: Correct. Most multimeters have a dedicated continuity mode.

questions.question: Which of the following is displayed on the Y-axis of a CRO screen?

explanations.a: Time is displayed on the X-axis.
explanations.b: Correct. Voltage is displayed on the Y-axis.

questions.question: To measure AC voltage in a multimeter, you should select:

explanations.b: Correct. ACV range is for AC voltages.
